III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
1

of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/20/2025, a youth was placed in an improper restraint. The
staff member put the youth in a headlock for about 17 seconds.
Investigation Interview
Complainant was interviewed on 08/21/2025. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 08/21/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth A stated Staff 1 was assigned as
his one staff to one youth ratio on 08/20/2025. Youth A stated
Staff 1 redirected him to hang up the phone because it was time to
get ready for bed and not time for phone calls. Youth A stated he
became angry and pushed Staff 1’s shoulders. Youth A stated
Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A’s arms and placed him in a
“headlock”. Youth A stated he told Staff 1 “to let go” and he was
released. Youth A stated he then punched Staff 1 (does not recall
where) and Crisis Response Team (CRT) 1 and CRT 2 moved
between him and Staff 1. Youth A stated CRT 1 and CRT 2
redirected him to calm down and the incident ended. Youth A
stated he was not injured in this incident and was not observed
with any marks or swelling on his neck. Youth A stated he saw the
nurse following this incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 08/21/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated he
was in the classroom when he saw Youth A running around the
unit. Youth B stated he saw Youth A hit Staff 1 and Staff 1 did not
react to it. Youth B stated he does not recall anything else about
the incident because he refocused on his meeting in the
classroom.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 08/21/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with Union Representative and another DHHS Worker.
Staff 1 stated he was assigned to Youth A as his one staff to one
youth ratio. Staff 1 stated he told Youth A that it was time to step
down for bed and not time for a phone call. Staff 1 stated Youth A
told him to “shut the fucking up, bitch” and hung up the phone.
2

Staff 1 stated Youth A punched him in the chest and Staff 1 then
tried to place Youth A in a primary restraint technique (PRT) hold.
Staff 1 stated Youth A pushed away from him and this resulted in
Staff 1 placing Youth A in a “headlock”. Staff 1 stated he let go of
Youth A and Youth A punched the side of Staff 1’s jaw. Staff 1
stated CRT 1 and CRT 2 stepped between Youth A and Staff 1
and verbally redirected Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A ran to the
other side of the unit and the incident ended. Staff 1 stated he was
not injured in this incident.
CRT 1 was interviewed on 08/21/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with Union Representative and another DHHS Worker.
CRT 1 stated Staff 1 was assigned to Youth A as his one staff to
one youth ratio. CRT 1 stated he heard Staff 1 redirect Youth A to
hang up the phone because it was bedtime. CRT 1 stated Youth A
hung up the phone and swung at Staff 1 twice. CRT 1 stated Staff
1 attempted to place Youth A in a PRT hold but Youth A shifted
his body causing Staff 1 to hold Youth A by his shoulders. CRT 1
stated he and CRT 2 redirected Staff 1 to release Youth A. CRT 1
stated Staff 1 released Youth A and Youth A swung at Staff 1.
CRT 1 stated he stepped between Youth A and Staff 1. CRT 1
stated Youth A ran to other side of the unit and took off his socks
but nothing further occurred because the focus shifted when a
youth on the other side of the unit threw a garbage can.
CRT 2 was interviewed on 08/29/2025 by phone. CRT 2 stated
Staff 1 told Youth A that he could not make a phone call because
it was time to get ready for bed. CRT 2 stated Youth A hung up
the phone and swung at Staff 1 twice. CRT 2 stated Staff 1 tried to
place Youth A in a PRT hold but his arms ended up around Youth
A’s shoulders. CRT 2 stated he redirected Staff 1 to release Youth
A. CRT 2 stated once released Youth A punched Staff 1 and ran
to the other side of the unit. CRT 2 stated nothing further occurred
between Youth A and Staff 1. CRT 2 stated Youth A was not
choked in this incident.
Video
Unit 3B 08/20/2025 video starting at 8:56 PM was reviewed. It
shows Staff 1 follows Youth A to the unit’s youth phone. Youth A
picks up the phone with his right hand, turns around, switches the
phone to his left hand, and hits Staff 1 in the chest with a semi-
fisted right hand. Youth A unsuccessfully places the phone on the
receiver as Staff 1 extends his arms and hands and holds Youth
A’s arms. Youth A resists Staff 1’s hold and backs himself into a
corner. Staff 1 and Youth A move away from the corner with Staff
1’s left elbow on the back of Youth A’s neck. The video does not
3

capture Staff 1’s right arm but it appears to hold on to something
on Youth A’s front side. Youth A’s right arm is around the middle
of Staff 1’s backside and the video does not capture his left arm
but it appears to hold something towards his front side. Staff 1
releases Youth A and Youth A takes a fighting stance and swings
and hits Staff 1 multiple times while Staff 1 moves away. It is
roughly 17 seconds from the time Youth A and Staff 1 are in the
corner by the phone and the time Youth A is released in the
walkway area. CRT 1 and CRT 2 intervene by moving towards
Youth A and Staff 1 and Youth A runs to the other side of the unit.
Another video camera shows Youth A on the other side of the unit
walking around while CRT 1 and Staff 1 shadow his steps. CRT 2
walks over to this side of the unit. Youth A removes his slides,
takes off his socks, and puts his slides back on. Youth A leans
against a chair and talks with CRT 1 and Staff 1 with CRT 2
standing nearby. Video does not record sound.
Documents Reviewed
Staff 1, CRT 1, and CRT 2 wrote incident reports that coincide
with their interviews.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention nursing note states Youth A
refused to be assessed on 08/20/2025 at 9:15 PM. It states Youth
A was observed without bruises, swelling or injury.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility utilizes Handle with
Care physical management model. Handle with Care training
materials do not include Staff 1’s description of his hold on Youth
A and Staff 1’s hold of Youth A as portrayed in the video.
Staff 1’s last Handle with Care training was completed on
06/05/2025. Staff 1 does not have a discipline history.
Unit Layout
Unit 3B’s youth telephone is positioned next to the staff desk area
near the entrance of the classroom. The staff desk area is
comprised of two parallel counters in front of the classroom. A
walkway runs parallel between the staff desk area and the unit
gym. This walkway leads to the other side of the unit, which is a
common area with residential chairs surrounded by youth
bedrooms.
Analysis The agency is in noncompliance when Staff 1 was unable to
secure Youth A in a primary restraint technique hold but kept his
arms above and around Youth A’s shoulders for approximately 17
seconds on 08/20/2025. Staff 1 should have disengaged from
4

Youth A when the primary restraint technique hold was not
implemented.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
